cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.SI. 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it focuses on improving Statistical Machine Translation (SMT) through bilingual word embedding. The paper also uses techniques such as neural networks, which are commonly used in natural language processing. 

The paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it involves the use of embedding models and dimensionality reduction techniques. 

The sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is also possible as the paper discusses the use of co-occurrence and pointwise mutual information between words to construct a bilingual word co-occurrence graph. 

The sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also possible as the paper involves the use of machine learning techniques to improve SMT. 

Finally, the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is also possible as the paper involves the use of graph-based methods to construct the bilingual word co-occurrence graph.
